comments:
Build ID: 0925

Steps To Reproduce:
Presently the build file creates a folder for the wse. This is not neccessary and should be changed to a jar file. A small change is required in the build.properties file.

More information:
Please also use this defect to remove unncessary files in the Web Services Explorer that was left from running on Tomcat.
*** Bug 204802 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

In the 20070926 WTP 3.0 I-build, the explorer source accounts for 690 files and 120 folder while the explorer plugin accounts for 552 files and 69 folders.  We definitely need to JAR those plugins.

Gil, could you please take care of this for M2 (to be declared next Wednesday)?  Which means checking in the change by early next week.

Gil, I've taken care of setting unpack="false" in the org.eclipse.wst.ws_ui.feature which contains the org.eclipse.wst.ws.explorer plugin.  So the source should be in zip format now.  You just have to JAR up the explorer plugin and make sure that the code still function correctly and the icons are all there after being JARred up.

More info can be found in:

http://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/platform-core/documents/3.1/run_from_jars.html

Created an attachment (id=79489)
change in wse

Gil, I made some modification to the proposed patch (removing bundle-classpath and removing some source-includes) and released the change to the explorer plugin. The WTP 3.0 build S-3.0M2-20071001213732 contains this change. When I tried clicking on "Run on WSE" the first time resulted in: HTTP ERROR: 500 Exception in JSP: /wsexplorer/wsexplorer.jsp:64 61: } 62: 63: // controller.init() 64: controller.init(sessionId,application,request.getContextPath()); 65: %> 66: 67: <% Stacktrace: RequestURI=/wse/wsexplorer/wsexplorer.jsp Powered by Jetty:// Clicking on "Run on WSE" a second time resulted in: HTTP ERROR: 500 Exception in JSP: /uddi/navigator_content.jsp:47 44: %> 45: 46:
47: <%=navigatorManager.renderTreeView(response)%> 48:
49: 50: Stacktrace: RequestURI=/wse/uddi/navigator_content.jsp Powered by Jetty:// I checked the org.eclipse.wst.ws.explorer_1.0.305.v200710012116.jar in the build and it contain: - wsexplorer/wsexplorer.jsp - wsexplorer/uddi/navigator_content.jsp So it looks like the WSE is somehow getting the Request URI wrong. Please take a look. If I unzipping the org.eclipse.wst.ws.explorer_1.0.305.v200710012116.jar into a org.eclipse.wst.ws.explorer_1.0.305.v200710012116 directory, then the WSE would run OK. Since we need the final code for WTP 3.0 M2 check in by EOD today, I have reverted the wst-ws-ui.map file to the previous tag for the WSE plugin (i.e. v200710012105 without the change for turning the WSE into a single JAR). Unless you can find the solution for this immediately, we'll have to leave the explorer plugin as a directory in WTP 3.0 M2 and revisit this after M2 is declared. As for the source zip, I checked the org.eclipse.wst.ws_ui.feature.source plugin and now the explorer src is properly in zipped up form.

I've reverted the code that change the explorer plugin to single JAR.   Here are the versions of the files containing the changes to change the explorer plugin to single JAR:

- Version 1.34 -  feature.xml in org.eclipse.wst.ws_ui.feature (adding unpack=false)
- Version 1.43 - manifest.mf in org.eclipse.wst.ws.explorer (removing bundle.classpath)
- Version 1.23 - build.properties in org.eclipse.wst.ws.explorer (changing to source.. and bin..)

The above versions can be used as a starting point for continuing this investigation for post WTP 3.0 M2.

I just checked the wtp-sdk-S-3.0M2-20071002141531 build and the wst.ws.explorer is now back to packaged as a directory. It's back functional again. The source directory is still in a zipped file. So we're OK for WTP 3.0 M2.
